page.title: 04PONTIN'S HOLIDAY CAMP
page.content: The camp covers 52 acres and was started in 1932 as a tented camp. These were replaced by wooden chalets and, later, permanent chalets were built. Each chalet has a bath and shower and sleeps up to 6 people. Pontin took over in 1958. The camp presently employs a staff of 240, 1 per 5 guests. It is equipped with modern kitchens serving up to 1000 meals a night and offering a wide range of self-service menus. There are ample {leisure} and {recreational} facilities: heated indoor pool, bingo, wrestling, 12 snooker tables, table tennis, T.V. and cinema, a large outdoor children's playground, putting, miniature golf, walking and the beach. The camp has its own linen service but no laundry. Security is minimal.
